Reviews.Title: Awesome product with some connection problems that I fixed.
Reviews.Author: Matthias Nott
Reviews.Content: This is really an excellent camera for Baby monitoring! I give it a 4 and not a 5 since I was having significant problems with the App that's provided by BabyPing.From my perspective, BabyPing goes to great lengths in order to make the setup process as simple as possible. They do an auto detection of the camera, and once that's done, you should just expect to launch the app and immediately see what's going on with your child.Yet, the simplicity of the app seems to be its weakness: It failed to connect most of the time for me, and when I was debugging the situation, I found out several things that I did not like, like the app requesting your WPA key over the network and also no way to do a port forward so that the grand parents can view the child - and no support of more than one camera.But there's no point complaining, as the camera itself is an excellent product.Taking that into account, I have written my own app for the camera. It is on the app store. Just search for BabyPing, you'll find it next to the app from BabyPing: It is called BabyPhoneViewerFree. Once you've set up your camera with the BabyPing app, you can use my viewer to connect to (up to four) BabyPing cams, and while the original app was failing to connect most of the time, my app seems to work more reliably and instantly connects. What's more, it supports VPN and Port Forwarding use scenarios, and also some level of zoom.In addition, the app allows to connect to many other types of webcams, e.g. traditional Y-Cams.The fact that I wrote the app is not a criticism about the product BabyPing itself. It is an excellent product, and that's why I invested some time in extending it, since I think this is really worth while for many parents around this world.And since fiddling with your app to connect to the camera is really the last thing you want to do if you hear your baby crying, I went on to improve an already excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioning Monitor, Unresponsive Customer Support
Reviews.Author: Julie Warrender
Reviews.Content: We had been using our monitor for about six months without issue when the audio stopped working. A loud static noise comes over the monitor and the 'your baby needs attention' message pops up incessantly. Stuff happens, I get that. I sent a message to support detailing the problem. No reply. Followed up a WEEK later, no reply. No response on Twitter and Facebook either. It turns out I'm not the only one.In this day and age, not updating the website and/or social media properties with a known issue and totally ignoring customer complaints is completely unacceptable. It's a shame too, because until this episode of appalling customer service I would have recommended BabyPing to new parents. Not a good job, guys. Not a good job at all.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy. I never rate products but this one makes me so mad I had to warn other people.
Reviews.Author: Sarah C. Whitaker
Reviews.Content: I did not register for this when my baby was born, but my friends pitched in and got it for us because the iPhone capability sounded cool. I feel bad that they wasted their money, we don't even bother turning this thing on and just sleep with our door open and our baby's door open. It NEVER CONNECTS, and when it does, it disconnects when your phone goes to sleep or the screen locks back. We should have just spent the extra $$ for the summer infant one from Babies R Us or gone with a simple audio monitor. I do not recommend this product to friends.

Reviews.Title: Good product!
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product when we were expecting our first baby in April of this year. It was easy to set up to the WiFi and get installed in the nursery. The thing that attracted us to this item was the fact that even though my husband is on the road every week for work, he would still be able to see the baby sleeping each night. We were able to do so by downloading the BabyPing+ app from the iTunes store. We have also set it up so that the grandparents can check in and see him sleeping as well. The good thing is that when you don't want anyone to be able to access the camera, you can shut that feature off. A plus about this product is that not just anyone can go in and see your baby in their nursery... You have to give them the access to be able to do so - that was initially a big concern for us that anyone on our WiFi network would be able to do this.I gave this product 4 stars instead of 5 because of the fact that if your WiFi connection weakens there will be a lag of 5 or so seconds on the camera. This was something we had anticipated especially working through a WiFi network, so it's not a huge disappointment. Not to mention we can usually hear him anyway if we are downstairs or in our bedroom upstairs. One thing that does bother me is in regards to the BabyPing app. Since our baby sleeps through the night, I'm not constantly checking the camera, but usually at least once a night it will close out on me so that I have to go in and re-open it. It's not a huge issue, just kind of a pain.Overall, it is a good product. One thing that would make it amazing is if you could talk back to the baby through the device that is in the nursery. I would recommend this product to all the tech savvy parents out there that are looking for a convenient way to keep tabs on their baby while they are napping or sleeping.

Reviews.Title: Good WiFi Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: leftride
Reviews.Content: I've been using the BabyPing monitor for over a month and have been pleased with the performance.  I purchased the BabyPing for 2 reasons: 1) the BabyPing iOS app seemed to be most feature rich of other iOS Baby monitors and 2) Y-Cam, the makers of the camera have a good reputation for web cams.So far the app/camera has worked well.  I have always had a good connection, there is a slight delay of 2-3 seconds, but nothing that would ever cause an issue.  BabyPing has also been updating the app and camera firmware regularly which I appreciate.  They have added a few new features and I hope they continue to do so.The only drawbacks I have found is that there isn't an easy way to travel with this camera...it requires bringing a network cable to setup the wifi connection, would be nice if the camera could save a list of WiFi connections and the camera would connect to which ever one was available.  That way you could set it up before hand and not need the network cable.  It would also be nice to see native apps available outside of iOS, or open up the web interface.Overall I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it! Great camera! But maybe not for everyone.
Reviews.Author: Liz S.
Reviews.Content: We love BabyPing and recommend it to friends, but in ADDITION to an old fashioned audio monitor, not in place of one (which is why I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars). Not everyone will feel comfortable with the price of BabyPing plus a (basic) audio monitor, but for us it was well worth it and there are several reasons we like it much better than just having a regular video monitor like the one from Summer Infant that several of my friends with babies have. First, we have found it really helpful to be able to check in on the baby while she's at home with a grandparent or sitter. Second, we happen to have a large home and when I'm all the way down in the laundry room in the basement at the other end if the house and the audio monitor gets staticky, I love being able to just pull out my phone and use BabyPing (our wifi signal is pretty strong all over because we have repeaters so all our Tivos/Rokus/mobile devices work all over). It's also great to have when I get down there and realize I've accidentally left the audio monitor 2 floors up! And when my hands are full my cell slips in my pocket while the bulky audio monitor doesn't.  My husband and I both have the app on our iPhones and our iPads and we even have an old device that we're not using and installed it on that (without our email or other private Info/apps, but with all of daughter's music) to let sitters/grandparents use. We don't let anyone else, even grandparents, have the app on their own devices so that we have complete control over who can peek in and when - fine for my husband to check it from work and potentially see me with breastfeeding, not so fine with me for anyone else!). I read in another review that you can actually let others have the app but then turn off their ability to peek in - I didn't realize this and am planning to read the manual and investigate that!I'm not a Luddite but I'm also not a tech expert, so my thoughts on the tech aspects of BabyPing probably won't be helpful for those of you who are very tech savvy. For those of you who aren't, BabyPing was easy to set up and the app is pretty straight forward and user-friendly. To initially set up the app I think you have to have the camera's unique and lengthy code and be on the same wireless network. It took less than 5 minutes though. Sorry I can't speak more to the security, but my husband, who is far more techy than I am, did a lot of research into this (and other network cams, video monitors and audio monitors) when we were deciding on what type of monitor(s) to get and he felt that this, plus a newer/better router he got, was very secure. Not my area of expertise though, as you can probably tell from how poorly I'm able to explain it!The camera's picture quality is quite good. It has audio and video (great night vision, color when lights are on), but I think that having a traditional audio monitor is key because even though I used to leave the video on my iPad on all night, once or twice something weird happened and it turned off. I think that was a bug fixed by an app update, but still.  Also, now that DD is 1 and sleeping much longer, I usually just leave the audio monitor on and only "tune in" to the video when I want to see if she's crying but will resettle herself or if she's crying and standing up totally awake and needs me to intervene. But I like being able to just use my phone if we have company, etc. Also when DD and I went to visit my parents for a couple weeks, all I had to pack was the camera since obviously I'd have my phone with me. We were also glad to be able to check in on her from afar when a dear friend stayed the night with her for our 5th wedding anniversary. We didn't go far - just to a fancy hotel near by - so that we could go back home if she totally refused all bottles. We knew our friend would try not to tell us if things were going poorly so it was amazing to be able to check in for a minute and then turn it off without having to text or call at crazy hours!BabyPing has been one of our best purchases. It wouldn't be a great fit for everyone, but for us it's awesome!

Reviews.Title: It's ok, nothing great.
Reviews.Author: Nigel Bird
Reviews.Content: Sofar I'm at a loss as to why this item costs so much.  There is nothing great about it, no 2 way communication, no pan/ tilt, no temperature or humidity readings.  Just a picture and sound ( that's delayed 2 or 3 seconds that I find unacceptable),  I find that the picture and sound drop out all the time.The ability to view from any internet connection is a great option when it works.

Reviews.Title: Hugely Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Utah Bliss
Reviews.Content: I spent a month trying to make this camera work. I couldn’t get it to stay connected to the wireless network (nothing else has a problem, and I have a number of things connected to the network). This meant that I could rarely use it to keep an eye on my 3 month old son while he napped, and instead I had to rely on a cheap audio monitor from Graco (which works perfectly, by the way). And I never could get the app to allow me to access my camera from outside our wireless network like it’s supposed to. Nothing but frustration from BabyPing, whose online support finally got back to me a day after the camera was returned to Amazon and my money had been refunded.Do yourself a favor and get a Dropcam. Simple to set up, and reliable, for quite a bit less money. Don’t waste your time or money on this product.

Reviews.Title: Great concept, poor execution...
Reviews.Author: Tim Taylor
Reviews.Content: Loved the idea of using my IOS devices to monitor our little one, and even being able to share the link so the Grandparents could enjoy.  That being said though, this product needs a lot of time before it'll be a legitimate competitor to some of the other GHZ spectrum competition.  BabyPing is a great concept, but relies on too many other variables to offer parents the service levels needed when monitoring newborns through 12 month-olds.  Even with a new/robust router, having the unit direct connected, having up-to-date IOS versions installed AND large, high-speed bandwidth, we experience delays of up to 7 seconds.  Further, the app wasn't stable enough to keep running in the background, so we had to constantly close and open the app in order to see what was happening in our nursery.  All in all, the BabyPing camera performed as it should, but relies on too many ancillary technologies to provide the same level of service as a traditional GHZ based monitor. As a side note, we engaged repeatedly with their support, who only offer a 14-day return policy.  This doesn't really help if you've purchased this in advance of Baby's arrival, and really don't use the monitor until 2m+.  We've since replaced ours with a Levana Astra and couldn't be happier with the performance.  If you've ever sleep trained, or stressed over a little one, go with the monitor that offers consistent performance and minimal delay.  I'm sorry to say that BabyPing isn't this monitor.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: brittanyred
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS MONITOR. Huge waste of money. The video and audio are great, though there is about a 9 second lag on mine. But the app hart opens and crashes with in seconds of being on. I gave up and just bought a vtech monitoring system.

Reviews.Title: Not streaming!
Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: Threw this money out the window. Time delay makes it so inefficient.save your money unless you're away from Home and it's not urgent to get to your baby right away

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: Adetayo S Mabadeje
Reviews.Content: You pretty much have to have the monitor right beside your modem to work. Connection frequently gets lost. Thankfully we have a good old fashioned basic inexpensive audio monitor!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work outside of the house as advertised
Reviews.Author: V808
Reviews.Content: Barely works inside and not at all outside. The set up is difficult and time consuming. It is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great but slow
Reviews.Author: Nicole M.
Reviews.Content: This item is great with local wi-fi use, but the app that you have to use when traveling out of the local wi-fi spot is a bit challenging. Other than that this is a solid product.

Reviews.Title: Good when it works
Reviews.Author: KrisRN929
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor because I wanted something multiple people could use from anywhere. It was relatively simple to set up. For someone who is not tech savvy though, it could be difficult. The picture and sound quality are great, when its on. Its not the most reliable for long periods of time. For naps, its great. During the night though, it doesn't ever stay connected for the whole night. The connection gets lost and it drops the picture a lot.

Reviews.Title: Best baby video monitor
Reviews.Author: MaryL
Reviews.Content: We have iphones and ipads etc and wanted a video monitor that was compatible.  After reading reviews on others models that had complicated installs or breaks in signal, I chose baby ping and am vary happy I did.  Do yourself a favor and just buy this one!  It was incredibly easy to install and sync to our devices, there is maybe a 2 second delay but that's it and we have had great luck with uninterrupted signals.  The regular babyping app is free.  For something like $2.99 you can buy the advanced app which lets you connect almost anywhere ...  even if mom and dad are out of the house.

Reviews.Title: Simple to use. Great purchase.
Reviews.Author: LeaScud
Reviews.Content: I bought this Cam to see what my nanny was up to when I was gone. I found an app that allowed me to use this camera and see my house from anywhere. It worked as plan. The nanny is gone. The new nanny has been great.

Reviews.Title: Definitely would not recommend!
Reviews.Author: Megan Anderson
Reviews.Content: Constantly loses connection to the wifi, 5-7 second delay on the camera and audio, and so slow to open the app. 3 or 4 nights now I've woken up to my baby crying not through the monitor but because we keep our door open. Look at the monitor and it has lost connection. Very frustrating. The sound and picture are great when it's actually working.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant tool and pretty cool too
Reviews.Author: Barney
Reviews.Content: I got a Baby Ping camera about 3 months ago to keep an eye on my new son.I don't normally do reviews but this one is worth it because everyone with a child needs one of these!You get the ability to keep an ear and eye on your child while they're asleep, don't have to run upstairs every time you hear a strange noise, and don't have to open the door to see if they're ok (ie waking them up), and all of that through you're iPhone (or iPad if I had one).The video image is very clear, even in night vision mode. It's easy to set up for pretty much anyone I think, and the instructions are not just a bad translation from another language which is rare these days. My only tiny gripe is that the video is about a second behind real time, but that's prefectly understandable and really not a problem.Possibly the best bit is that it can run in the background on your phone rather than having to have the app constantly on screen.Two thumbs firmly up.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Miller
Reviews.Content: I really like the BabyPing.  I love being able to see my baby at all times throughout the night on my iPhone.  However, the audio is way too sensitive...we use a white noise machine and it is constantly picking that up.  And when the baby cries it is delayed and not very recognizable (I assume the problem is more the App on this than the camera).  We still have to use our old audio monitor in addition to the camera just to get proper sound notification from his room.Other than that...the camera works great (2-3 second delay).  The nighttime vision is pretty clear and I love the ease of having a "bird's eye" view on my baby.  Wish I had gotten it sooner.  One other problem with the App is you can't zoom in to the picture.  But if you turn your phone horizontal it goes to a bigger picture (although not a zoom)...it's just bigger on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Completely unreliable.  Great concept, poorly executed.
Reviews.Author: mrr123
Reviews.Content: I purchased just after my daughter's birth.  It was and remains extremely inconsistent.  I had to purchase a second, sound only monitor to use 100% of the time.  I only use this get visual confirmation of what she is doing once I hear her on the sound monitor.  You cannot rely on this at night because it frequently will disconnect.  If you are not awake to restart the wifi connection, you will not know if you baby wakes up.  And, at times, it will completely disconnect requiring you to take the video out of the babies room, hook up directly to the internet and reset the whole thing (sometimes several times in a row).Its a great concept, poorly executed. Overall, very disappointed and would NOT recommend.  It is completely unreliable as a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Good idea, bad execution and terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: ASP
Reviews.Content: I purchased the BabyPing camera to use as a secondary monitor with my infant daughter to allow my wife and I to remotely check in if we leave her with a babysitter.  I read all the reviews and fully understood the frustrations with BabyPing before I made the purchase - glitchy software, app that frequently disconnects, challenging wifi set-up, etc.And while all of the issues did surface for me, the reason for my one star review is the abysmal customer service experience.Within the first year, I have had two cameras break and need to be replaced.  The MAC address of the first was somehow corrupted, meaning that the camera couldn't stream to the remote BabyPing+ viewing app, and the second would not work in the dark - there was an issue with the sensor that switches between the standard and infrared cameras.Clearly there are quality control issues, but I assume it's just bad luck to have two devices breakdown for such different reasons.Each time the cameras stopped functioning, I called BabyPing customer service directly (in the UK).  Both times, my initial calls were pleasant and helpful - polite, seemingly attentive and informed representatives who assured me that these were unfortunate, one off issues.  Both times, the agents immediately offered to send a replacement on an expedited basis, and arrange for a no hastle pick up of the defective device.And both times, these initial calls were followed up by radio silence and weeks of inaction.  I ultimately needed to chase down the representatives over an extended period in order to get help.While I think it's an unfortunate coincidence that my two cameras broke down, I'm wary that this lip service approach to customer interaction when there are issues is standard operating procedure.Needless to say, I would not buy another BabyPing product.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful (baby) Monitor!
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Picked this monitor based on prior reviews, and it works great. Set it up in less than five minutes and updated firmware.  Wonderful video at night and great apps for idevices (apple iOS) at home (BabyPing) and while out of network via World Wide Web (BabyPing+)! Small delay (2-5 seconds) in video and audio feed, but not a big deal. Could not be more pleased with BabyPing! Great value!

Reviews.Title: Does not work unless adjacent to router
Reviews.Author: Julia Cardamone
Reviews.Content: Device does not work outside of 10 ft from the router. I would not recommend if you plan to use monitor in a room different from your router.

Reviews.Title: Good monitor for iOS users.
Reviews.Author: Across the Brandywine
Reviews.Content: We were a bit skeptical after reading some reviews, and my husband is more up on the technical side of things, but once we got this up and running, we've never had any major issues using it at home. The only challenge has been the "plus" app that allows you to watch when you're away from home. Sometimes we have trouble connecting with that, but we rarely use it so it's not a big issue.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Deborah L Cannaday
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my son and daughter-in-law. They are having their first child and they like the fact that they can monitor the baby from their iPhone and iPad. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Monitor
Reviews.Author: Melb
Reviews.Content: It took less than 15 minutes to install and set up on three devices (one ipad, and two iphones). It works great for our son, who is having night terrors and we can make sure he's ok without waking him up. The only downside is that there is a 5 second delay on iPhone and a 3 second delay on iPad. It is great that we can finally go out and be able to check on him from anywhere. When using baby ping+ software from outside home, you typically have to refresh about every 15 minutes. The picture quality is excellent on day and night vision camera. We did not experience any "lines" or poor video quality at all, as some other users noted. Depending on where you position the camera in the room will determine the audio quality (it can sound high pitched), although you just need to adjust the placement of the monitor to get the best audio and video. I highly recommend this monitor to any Apple user.

Reviews.Title: Had high hopes...
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this monitor after not having success with any of the 'traditional' monitors.  However, I am disappointed with this monitor for the following primary reasons:-frequently loses the connection (to be fair, our wireless isn't great but our house is way smaller than the sq ft coverage it claims)-does not adequately notify you if you've lost the connection (should this occur in the middle of the night, I want to know!)-when minimizing the application, many times it drops it all togetherThe only reason we are keeping it is so that my husband can use the remote application (which works pretty well).  I had to also get the Motorola to use at night...

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this unless you like to fiddle with WiFi technology as a hobby.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Muehlherr
Reviews.Content: This product includes a great camera and a crappy iPhone app. The installation is tricky, and it took me a whole day to get it to work. The configuration of the WiFi is the worst, I have ever seen in a WiFi enabled product. Every change requires you to wait 90 seconds. That is ridiculous. The connections still constantly drops. It is allows really picky about your WiFi router an network encryption. The iPhone app is a power monger. The product/software designers should look at products like the Nest Thermostat to see how its done. The remote viewing site does not work for me. Could not yet figure out why. I am a CS major and I have problems. A regular mom is lost with this product. The only good thing is the camera who delivers sharp and clear pictures, if you actually get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Very UNRELIABLE
Reviews.Author: Penpall
Reviews.Content: I would recommend you to stay away from this product because it is unreliable.  It is constantly dropping the connection.  There is a 5 second lag in the feed on the baby ping app and about a 30 second lag on the baby ping plus app, yes a full half minute.When working it has a great picture and very good night vision.  But for reliability it can't be trusted.  FYI, we have high speed internet through comcast cable company and an airport extreme wireless router.  All our other wireless products work flawlessly.  Ipads, TVs, computers, phones, etc...

Reviews.Title: Bad wifi connectivity
Reviews.Author: Fabian Soria
Reviews.Content: Item loses connection constantly, app spends more time "reconnecting" or "looking for camera" than actually showing live feed. Delay is 5-7seconds.On the advantages side, image quality and nigh vision work well (when you are able to connect to the camera). Set up is easy and quick.Maybe this product works well in a small apartment. But for a two level house, it's clearly not the right choice

Reviews.Title: Disappointing at best...
Reviews.Author: HauteWifeChicMum
Reviews.Content: Ordered this monitor thinking great things only to hook it up, see a 5-7 second delay, poor video feed (lines across screen) and sound quality of a tin can that would start ringing then get progressively louder. Not ideal for a sleeping baby not to mention surprising considering we have a small apartment. The worst is that we called BabyPing directly that evening and no one has returned our calls (that was 5 days ago). Going to try a different product...good luck if you decide on this one.

Reviews.Title: so so
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I had it set up in the garage so I could see my dogs while I was out of the country. It worked about 1/2 of the first 1/2 of my trip, then not at all. I haven't checked to see how it works since I've been home, but I'm hoping it'll work again when I leave again in July

Reviews.Title: not great at first but improved and works great!
Reviews.Author: brenda petersen
Reviews.Content: In the beginning, we also lost connection a lot like others have said, but after I restarted it once it began to work great! The baby ping app lets us see our daughter clearly while we're in the house, and the baby ping+ app lets us see our daughter when we are not at the house (It has a 45 sec. delay). The monitor does need a fast connection from your wifi otherwise it could cause other devices in your home that use wifi to run slower we found out, but the restart helped alot with that too. Overall, it is a great monitor, and I love that I can see my child when I'm not at home with her and a sitter is.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product
Reviews.Author: D. J. Darroch-Thompson
Reviews.Content: Great product - connects easily to the Wifi and allows us to watch our baby no problem - there's a delay of maybe a second or two, but never more than that. We've even had it on when we've been at a restaurant having hired a baby sitter, and it worked perfectly. I'd recommend this to anyone who's worried about their child, as most parents are, but still wants to maintain some kind of normality in their life!!

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this!!!
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Just save yourself the trouble and get another monitor...any other monitor!  It does not consistently work....and as a parent the whole reason you get a monitor is to monitor your child.....this product is a gamble because you may get to or may not! It will lose connection to wifi over and over and sometimes just NOT connect at all! My husband and I thought "oh how cool, we can use our iPhones and iPad." WRONG!!  Seriously annoyed with this and I'm returning it!!

Reviews.Title: New app makes all the difference
Reviews.Author: Ananna
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this camera a month or so ago and it worked ok at first, but now they have updated the app it is brilliant.  Also they have released the feature that lets you look at your camera from anywhere and that works really well.  We adore our babyping now! Its really good and the night vision is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Would be awesome if it worked!
Reviews.Author: D. Hanson
Reviews.Content: I thought that this would be the solution to my baby monitor problem.  We have a large house and traditional baby monitors don't have the range to work for us.  We have a solid, commercial grade Wi-Fi network (Cisco Aeronet) in our house that gives us full coverage through every room.  When I received the product I attempted to perform the initial setup.  The included directions are pretty sparse and very dumbed down so the setup looked like it would be easy.  I downloaded the app from the Apple app store on both my iPhone and my iPad.  After following the directions to the T the app simply could not locate the baby monitor.  Thinking that I had a bad unit I tried the second unit that I had purchased.  I tried all of the troubleshooting tips on the Baby Ping website and none worked.  I sent an e-mail to the tech support dept at Baby Pink and they took a full 3 days to get back to me.  Their only advice was to un-install the app from my iPhone / iPad and then re-install it.  After doing this and still not having any success I replied to the e-mail from tech support and I still have not heard back (that was 2 days ago).  I have decided that this product is just too unreliable to chance having it not work and ending up with an angry baby crying all night.  I am retuning the product to Amazon and will be exploring some other options.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!!

Reviews.Title: False description
Reviews.Author: Jullie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera since I thought that I can use my ipad to check on my daughter when I am away. Turns out that you need to connect the camera and the ipad to the same wifi in order to use it. I already had a camera and I monitor for that purpose so turned out useless for me. The description should be more informative.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't maintain connection
Reviews.Author: Mama-to-be
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this monitor! Set-up was easy (although I did have to follow one trouble-shooting step, it was just unplugging the wireless router and plugging it back in).Unfortunately, the app kept telling me the connection was lost; so not only is the monitor unusable as a reliable monitor, it kept waking me up with beeping to tell me about the lost connection. My home is only 1000 sq. ft. and the monitor was in the room right next to mine...the router in the room right next to that. When it was working there is also really loud feedback noise.I had to return this immediately.

Reviews.Title: Like it, room for improvement
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: My husband bought the device 2 month ago. We have just starting to use it.  unfortunately we do not have an iphone. My husand is anti-Apple person;-)  we are connecting it to my Ipad. I am really impressed about the image quality and the simple interface. Being able to view on a bigger screen ( Ipad ), just great.For improvement,  I am really hoping, babyping can support andriod, so my husband  can see our little one while he is away - i do not even mind to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: babyping dont waste your time or money
Reviews.Author: Barri Cornwall "Gadget geek"
Reviews.Content: ********Update*******Well i was hoping the app would get better and not worse. On IO5 i had numerous issues with it not connecting to my wi-fi even though all my devices had full signal in the same room. I then change my router brand from linksys to N band belkin and had the same exact issues. i put up with it as i was not using it currently as baby was still in our room and was hoping for a app update to fix the issues which never come. the day was approaching we were gonna leave the baby in his room. I purchased the Apple airport extreme router which had less range than my Belkin N band but thought this router must have been one that the system was tested with but my signal dropped to zero bars and wouldn't even find the cam. I then went out and purchased a second airport router to increase the range and i then got 3 bars with the second router 3ft from the camera. It would then sometimes find the cam but still unreliable. I then found out after messing for 3 hours that the babyping will not connect to the extended network router which is 3ft from the babyping cam. i had to plug the router into the closer router for it to use the router with the more powerful signal. it is now connected to the closer router until the power from the babyping goes off or the router goes off so power outages will require to set it up each and every time. Now come the other problems. The IOS5 app will cut off after 30mins each and every time. we have 4 Apple devices and the ipad 1 and 3 are the only devices that stay connected. the Iphone 4 and 4s will disconnect after 30mins. even my friends iphone5 does the same thing. We updated to the IOS6 app and now more problems than before. Now the Ipads get a blank screen and they have a diagonal bar that one side is light grey and the other dark grey and the picture stops on this screen. The iphones do something different. The screens will just go blank and the sound will stop. this happens after only a couple of mins. then after about 30-50 seconds it will show the Oops we have a problem screen. I have also tried the Baby phone App which a reviewer on here wrote. I have the same shut down issues on his app as the babyping app so i guess its an issue with the cam.I would steer clear of this product until all issues have been sorted. I have over $500 in routers purchased because of this Cam and more than 18hrs of my time messing with it and the cost of the cam and it still don't work.Another warning when upgrading the App to IOS6 version of the babyping app. It has messed my wifi up and i can no longer connect to my wi-fi. i never had issues with wi-fi until the second i installed this app and now i have issues. It will disconnect my wi-fi from the phone and i have to go into settings to select the wi-fi again.

Reviews.Title: Junk!  Buyer Beware.  Do not waist your time!!!
Reviews.Author: frogger90
Reviews.Content: writing this review on my husbands behalf since I'm the one that uses this product.  Instructions were pretty simple to follow for setting it up but it just did not want to connect even though I guarantee I was doing it correctly.  finally when it connected I was ready to unplug and go put it up in my child's room when it disconnected again.  when puting in wifi password again to get it to reconnect it said password was wrong.  when trying again hours later it finally took the password (same password, I promise I did not enter it in wrong).  finally got it all set up and started using it.  the night vision is not the best as its almost too bright.  honestly that would not be a big deal but it kept disconnecting and reconnecting on its own. the first couple hours it was just a few times, not too terrible.  then as time went on (24hrs) it got worse and worse and stopped reconnecting.  I currently (30hrs) still have it set up and it only works 10% of the time.  It is not the wifi connection cause we have other things on our wifi that were working just fine during this whole time.  oh and the lag.  I expected a 3 second delay for a wifi camera but sometimes the delay was as much as 10 seconds and it was not even consistent as to when it was only 3 seconds and when it was 10 seconds.  I would not recommend this camera at all.  and I never write reviews cause I don't have the time, but I want consumers to be aware of this expensive piece of crap!!!  I will be returning this.

ProductInfo.Features:
Uses your home Wi-Fi network to connect you to your baby through your iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch
High quality video and audio monitor with automatic invisible nightvision - see your baby at any time, without disturbance
Simple to setup - setup in minutes direct from your iOS device, no computer needed
Double-layer security - leading encryption methods plus password protection gives total control & privacy
Alerts to suit you - get audio or vibrate alerts, notifications when on calls, low wi-fi warnings and more
